body.p: In 2001 the International Accounting Standards Board (IASB) began operations in succession to IASC. The IASB’s initial agenda included a project to make limited amendments to the financial instruments standards issued by IASC. The IASB decided to incorporate the consensus from Draft Interpretation D‑34 as part of those amendments. In June 2002 the IASB published an exposure draft of amendments to IAS 32 Financial Instruments: Disclosure and Presentation that incorporated the proposed consensus from Draft Interpretation D‑34.
